news_header: The European Parliament has approved a €35 billion loan to support Ukraine against Russia, backed by frozen Russian assets.
news_text: The European Parliament voted 518-56 in favor of a €35 billion grant to Ukraine, aimed at assisting the country in its defense against the ongoing Russian conflict. This loan is part of the EU's contribution to a larger G7 package totaling $50 billion, agreed upon in June. The repayment of the loan is expected to be facilitated by additional revenue from the frozen assets of the Russian Central Bank, with the European Council already in support. The goal is to ensure payments to Ukraine in the coming year.
